alert.note: Alert for Kingfisher; Lincoln; Logan; Noble; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 08 at 2:29AM CDT until August 08 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Kingfisher County in central Oklahoma... Northwestern Lincoln County in central Oklahoma... Southwestern Noble County in northern Oklahoma... Logan County in central Oklahoma... Western Payne County in central Oklahoma... * Until 315 AM CDT. * At 229 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles northeast of Lake Mcmurtry to 6 miles northeast of Dover, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Stillwater, Guthrie, Perkins, Hennessey, Langston, Crescent, Cashion, Tryon, Ripley, Agra, Coyle, Cedar Valley, Marshall, Mulhall, Cimarron City, Orlando, Meridian, Lake Carl Blackwell, Lake Mcmurtry, and Lovell. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
